name: chicagotribune
text:
Joe Biden slammed President Trump for directing authorities to drive back peaceful protesters outside the White House yesterday using tear gas and flash grenades “in order to stage a photo op.”

Biden also urged Congress to enact “real police reform.” https://t.co/5ebor6xav7

name: chicagotribune
text: During a meeting with black community leaders in Omaha, Nebraska Gov. Pete Ricketts, a former co-owner of the Chicago Cubs, said, “The problem I have with you people,” prompting condemnation from a local pastor and a statement from the Chicago Cubs. https://t.co/Vz8wo22pwr

name: chicagotribune
text:
Too late now, we have seen people wondering why America didn’t listen to Colin Kaepernick, didn’t heed and understand, even as we know the answer: Why should it when nothing was at stake?

@TribuneKevin's column: https://t.co/otEdPpMrSh

name: chicagotribune
text:
On April 5, 1968, Chicago erupted with anger over the death of Martin Luther King Jr. Thousands took to the streets, smashing windows and setting buildings ablaze.

Five decades later, many wonder why neighborhoods on the West Side never fully recovered: https://t.co/kwEA3iwhhc
